channel.title: Social Entrepreneurship on Lewwwk
channel.description: Recent content in Social Entrepreneurship on Lewwwk

item.title: The unexpected is always the highlight.
item.description:
:::: entry-content I recently attended the Skoll World Forum{.zem_slink rel=“homepage”} on Social Entrepreneurship. Going in I didn’t have much of an agenda but did end up with an experience that was worthwhile and possibly pivotal. The reason of course, as with all events it seems, is the people that gathered and connected.

From the content and conversation perspective, the highlight for me was the focus on systems as core to social entrepreneurship{.zem_slink rel=“wikipedia”}. Roger Martin{.zem_slink rel=“wikipedia”} tagged disrupting and establishing equilibria as the ultimate purpose, and previously tired conversations around metrics became flavoured with the emergent dynamics of working at the level of systems. While applying rigour to scale and diffuse innovation was a hot topic, people also recognized that the most innovative work often reflects insanity before it becomes recognized as brilliance. That this conversation was happening here was a good thing.

item.title: Social Innovation @ Ivey
item.description:
::::::: entry-content Quick post to share today’s presentations for Social Innovation @ Ivey.

First is my opening intro, which pulls from a core theme but adds a little more about my history and the levels, forms, and tools of social entrepreneurship  – or my best simplification of them.

:::: {#__ss_3528660 style=“width: 425px;”} we’re screwed

::: {style=“padding: 5px 0 12px;”} View more presentations from Michael Lewkowitz. ::: ::::

The second, is a for a last minute stand-in role on the social finance workshop.  Thankfully the wise and gracious Karim Harji of SocialFinance.ca shared this great, detailed deck.
